file_content.text: We've got to make up for lost time.
The surveillance network dropped like a meteor once those generators came down. Nicely done.
The Republic still has plenty of troops here. Stay vigilant.
Don't let your guard down.
Without the Republic hounding our every step, we'll hit our targets.
No problem.
That was a waste of time.
Well, I appreciate the help.
All right, men, on your feet! Let's blow things up!
We're counting on you to take out those surveillance generators.
The Republic was expecting us! It's like they knew our attack plan.
Quit flapping and get me a casualty count.
My lord. Corporal Haddon, Operations Group Three--what's left of it, anyway.
Corporal Haddon, sir, Operations Group Three--what's left of it, anyway.
Corporal Haddon, Operations Group Three--what's left of it, anyway
The Republic's all over us. Thanks to their advanced surveillance network, we can't even scratch our noses--much less blow anything up.
Overwhelm their defenses with superior forces. Let them watch their own annihilation.
That shouldn't stop you.
I'm not sure how "superior" this bunch is--we're better off knocking out the monitors.
A surveillance system that extensive could serve us well.
Let's seize their network.
It's too big to commandeer from a single source. Better to just shut the whole thing down.
A few kilos of detonite and a couple ion grenades should handle it.
Demolish their security.
Think I haven't tried that? The network's shielded. Couldn't put a dent in it.
Slice into the system. Use their own surveillance against them.
Hijack their network.
Can't. The network uses alien technology. Only option is to shut the whole thing down.
I take it you're with demolitions.
Eager to blow up something?
Got a list of targets ripe for slagging, but the Republic's always in our way.
Must be frustrating to get slapped around like that.
Sounds humiliating.
Yeah, we have many colorful nicknames for that surveillance system.
We've located the surveillance network's power generators. They go down, the Republic goes blind.
Trouble is, we can't get near them--but you could. If you knock out the power generators, we'll do the rest.
I'll take those generators apart with my bare hands, if I have to.
Consider it done.
Unfair advantages are our specialty; we mustn't allow the Republic to enjoy such tactics.
Consider it done.
One pile of rubble, coming up.
Consider it done.
I'll have that surveillance down before you know it.
Consider it done.
I suppose so.
The Republic's not stupid. Expect the generators to be crawling with security; we'll regroup here.
No way. [Refuse quest]
Then if you'll excuse me....
I can't talk now. I've got wounded to tend to.
